availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Marion Johnson (Platte County, Missouri, physician)

body.p: Platte County, Missouri, physician. Kentucky native. Son of Garland Johnson and Thirza Ann Johnson. Married to Mary J. Timberlake Johnson in Platte County, Missouri, on November 9, 1855. Father of Laura Johnson, Medora Johnson, Lavina Johnson, and Benjamin F. Johnson. Schoolteacher in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Physician in Platte County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 412A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Missouri, Platte County, Lee, p. 840.
Missouri, U.S., Marriage Records, 1805-2002, Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, MO, Platte County.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Scott County Wills, vol. R-S, 1874-1896, p. 47.
